#AskBQ is BloombergQuint’s daily offering where market experts help investors make the right investment choice — be it in equities, commodities or the derivatives markets.On Tuesday’s episode, Raja Venkatraman, chief technical analyst at Chart Advice and Sandeep Jain, director at Tradeswift Broking Private Ltd. gave their views on ONGC, SBI Life Insurance, BHEL and many more.






Watch the full conversation:











Edited Excerpts from the conversation:






Shashank Tripathi: I bought ONGC at Rs 168. The company has declared a bonus of 2:1. Should I hold or sell?Sandeep Jain: I would recommend you to book profits at Rs 215-220.






Shivang Bhatt: I want to invest in SBI Life and ICICI Prudential with a long term view. Is it the right time to invest? Also which is the best bet among these?Sandeep Jain: ICICI Prudential can be a good buy for long-term.






Mayur: I want to invest in Rain Industries with a long-term view. Is it the right time to invest?Raja Venkatraman: Look for dips near Rs 280-290. Trade with a stop-loss of Rs 260 with an upward target of Rs 350.






Amitabh Upadhyaya: What is your view on the telecom space?Sandeep Jain: I prefer Bharti Airtel and Reliance Industries. 






Bhavani Shankar Behra: What are your views on Goa Carbon and Phillips Carbon for one or two months, should we invest more or exit?Raja Venkatraman: I would recommend you to avoid Goa Carbon. 






Ravi Shankar: I bought Deep Industries at Rs 315 six months ago. What should I do?Sandeep Jain: I would recommend you to hold on to the levels of Rs 275.






Girish Babu: What are your view on JP Associates?Sandeep Jain: I would recommend you to avoid such stocks. Exit at  bounce if you have invested in this company.






Pawan Kumar: What are suggestions on Lupin?Raja Venkatraman: I would recommend you not to hold below Rs 1,000 if  invested. Avoid the stock if you were interested in buying.






Brijesh Timaniya: I bought Future Enterprise at Rs 55 and Sintex Industries at Rs 29.Sandeep Jain: I would recommend you to hold on to the stock. For Future Enterprise, advisable to book profits at current levels.






Prashant Dattatreya: Bought 50 shares of Infosys at Rs 927 with a short-term view. Should I hold or sell?Raja Venkatraman: I would recommend you to hold.






Himanshu Bajpayee: I bought 4,000 shares of Suzlon Energy at Rs 21 with a one-year view. Should I hold or sell?Raja Venkatraman: I would recommend you to keep a stop-loss at Rs 15 and exit at his cost price.






Lakshmi Narayana: I bought PNB Housing finance at Rs 1,500. Should I average?Sandeep Jain: I would not recommend you to average at current levels. I feel LIC Housing Finance is a good to buy at current levels. You can also look to buy DHFL and HDFC. 






Mayur Sharma: I bought 50 shares of Nucleus Software at Rs 279 with a short-term view. Should I hold or sell?Raja Venkatraman: I would recommend you to hold with stop-loss of Rs 325.






Sandeep Joshi:  I bought 500 shares of Cords Cable at Rs 119 What are your views on the stock?Raja Venkatraman: You can buy on dips on Cords Cable.






Ritwik Sharma: I bought 2,000 shares of Yes Bank at Rs 322 with a one-year view. Should I hold or sell?Sandeep Jain: You can hold on with a target of Rs 370.






Avinash Pandey: What is your view on IDFC Bank for a one-year horizon?Sandeep Jain: Stay invested if you are holding. You can buy on declines if you want to invest in the stock.






Avinash Devilliers: I hold 300 shares of Hindustan Copper with a short-term view. What should be the exit price?Raja Venkatraman: Hold with a trailing stop-loss of Rs 90.






Raghavendra Mani: I bought Mannapuram Finance at Rs 96. What should be the exit price?Raja Venkatraman: I would recommend you to hold on to the stock.






Balaji Srinivas: I bought 1,000 shares of BHEL Rs 99. Should I sell or hold?Raja Venkatraman: You can look to exit at current levels.
title: Should You Invest In BHEL, ONGC Or SBI Life? #AskBQ
